DOC.brief_summary: The hypothesis present study hydration nulliparous woman 250ml/hour vs. 125ml/hrs would decrease rate primary cesarean section .
DOC.brief_title: Hydration Rate Cesarean Delivery Among Nulliparous
DOC.detailed_description: For non-blinded randomized clinical trial ( RCT ) recruit approximately 670 woman meet inclusion criterion across three site ( Eastern Virginia Medical School ( EVMS ) , University Arkansas Medical Sciences ( UAMS ) Obstetrix Medical Group , California ) . When patient schedule induction physician present L & D induction labor , cervical dilation admission le 4 cm , participant consent , randomize study intervention group . Both group receive maintenance IV hydration Lactated Ringer 's ( LR ) solution : Group I receive LR 125 ml/hr group II receive LR 250ml/hr . Other rate maintenance IV infusion , two group receive routine intrapartum care .
DOC.criteria: • Nonanomalous singleton Nulliparous ( prior delivery 20 week ) Presenting ≥37 week gestation Presenting anticipated induction labor spontaneous labor ( regular contraction 2 hour ) , cervical dilation le 4 cm Rupture membrane Expected deliver one participate hospital • Not inclusion criterion Autoimmune disorder ( antiphospholipid antibody , lupus , rheumatoid arthritis , scleroderma ) Diabetes mellitus—gestational pregestational Enrollment another randomize clinical trial Hematologic disorder ( coagulation defect , sickle cell disease , thrombocytopenia , thrombophilia ) Hypertension ( chronic pregnancy induce ) randomization HIV ( human immunodeficiency virus ) Placenta previa / 3rd trimester bleed Renal insufficiency ( serum creatinine > 1.5 mg/dL ) Restrictive lung disease Seizure disorder medication Thyroid disease medication Any contraindication vaginal delivery ( breech , active herpes , schedule cesarean , abnormal fetal heart tracing )
